comment: Explain everything so clearly, are super approachable, and genuinely care about student success. The lectures are well-organized and actually enjoyable, and they're always open to questions. Tests were fair and based on what was taught—no surprises. If you go to class and do the work, you'll do well. Highly recommend taking any class they teach!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I highly recommend this class and this professor!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures are clear, organized, and actually interesting. He genuinely cares if students understand the material and are always open to questions. The exams were fair if you kept up with readings and went to class. Definitely take notes and don't fall behind. I highly recommend this class and this professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you put in the work for this class and Professor Nazari sees that you are trying, you will get an A. I took him for 1111 and 1113 and loved him. Yes, his lectures are fast paced and homework is in ALEKS, but if you ask questions and show that you care about the class/ material, you will pass. He gives partial credit on tests if you show work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Outstanding teacher, creates supportive& engaging learning environment. Explains concepts clearly, always willing to help, truly cares about their students' success. Their passion for teaching is evident, they make the subject interesting&accessible. I've learned a lot in their class and feel more confident in my abilities b/c of their guidance.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Respected

comment: Avoid this prof if ur taking 5+ courses and if math doesn't come instantly easily: Mandatory attendance is unproductive. You'll waste extra time self-teaching. The instructor rushes through problems, skips steps, and lacks clear explanations. Failed final = Course fail (no warning given) Sometimes No time to self teach cuz of heavy workload
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He gives examples the entire class time without explaining how he did it or actually teaching anything.

I highly recommend this teacher to anyone willing to put in the effort. makes sure to provide all the resources needed to succeed. key to thriving in this class is simply showing up, participating, and putting in the work. If you give it your best effort, teacher will go above and beyond to support you, and the grade will reflect that.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: If you come across any negative reviews, they are likely from students who didn't put in the necessary work or attend class regularly. This teacher doesn't give easy grades, but they are fair and always reward effort. Stick with it, and you'll see that the hard work is well worth it.
rating_tags: Caring--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Nazari is, admittedly, a little dry when it comes to class time; however, that shouldn't deter you from taking the class. He does a lot of examples in class which supplement learning via ALEKS. If you're able to do the homework before class, instruction time serves more as practice than learning. He's very thorough teaching the process.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: He knows what he is teaching, but doesn't teach. All he does is write down the problems and you copy them down. Uses Alexx and it'll teach you everything. Quiet speaker in a large room with a mumbly voice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He always responds to emails and is accessible outside of class. He explains everything and tells you what's on the exam.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Nazari is very caring and understanding. He fully explains everything and goes through everything important in his lectures. If you show up and ask questions he will know you care about your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Take professor Nazari. Make sure you show up and take notes. He will take the time to answer your questions and he makes sure you understand the material. You will pass if you just put in the work like any other class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment:
Course is passable if you're willing to put in the effort. Like any other class, success is your participation and engagement.
Show up every day and be present in the moment. Paying attention and taking notes during lectures makes a significant difference. Ask questions whenever you have doubts he is approachable and gives clarification.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: he wasn't that bad. If you have horrible procrastination tendencies and get bored easy just don't take him. Keep up with homework through the semester, COME TO CLASS and pay attention, you do great!! The reviews he gives right before the test are just like the test just slightly different. ALL HW due at end of course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Nazari was a difficult professor, his teaching was clear, but often hard to understand. If you didn't ask questions about topic he briefly covered, he would move on to the next concept. You really just gotta lock in if you take him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: I have never struggled with math in the past and this prof made this class was very challenging. He takes attendance every class, all homework is on ALEKS, tests in person. He was not good at answering questions. I went to every class and still struggled and had to get outside help. He does curve the tests, but he's slow grader. Wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Good professor. The tests were easy as long as you paid attention to his lectures. Everything on the tests he went over, gives study guides and curves grades. 3 tests, a final, and ALEKS hw make up the grade. ALEKS is very helpful when studying for tests and he extends deadlines. As long as you pay attention and put in the effort, very easy class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: If you are not good at math don't take him. He doesn't teach he just explains how to do it, and when you have questions hes not good at answering them. He did curve all of my tests a lot though. He also pushed back all the assignments till the end of the semester.
If you are not good at math, he doesn't teach everything so well but I thought he was pretty good.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: (THIS IS FOR MATH 1111) For the First day of his class, it was pretty awful because for starters, he will introduce math already such as starting the lecture. Addition to that, he will think that you guys know math already that you don't need any help or guidance. Don't take this professor If math is your weakness because he goes by FAST.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: He seems like a nice guy but he doesnt elaborate much and just does practice problems over and over the whole class. It's hard to stay engaged and it gets confusing. All homeworks are online on aleks, he extends deadlines on them often. The test aren't bad but not the easiest
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Just like any other math class you need to come prepared and do the homework and practice and ask questions and you will do well. Professor Nazari is wonderful!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: His classes were very informative. You can tell he loves his job! He is very passionate.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I enjoyed Mr. Nazari's class. Be prepared to listen/take notes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Respected

comment: this class was fully online which I figured would be easy. However, I was wrong. Over 39 hours put into my homework just for half of them to be omitted. studying for hours just to take the tests and barley getting a C. Also make sure you give yourself the full 2 hours for the tests you'll need it!!! I did enjoy the class but be wary.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly, this man is a good person, but his lectures weren't helpful. When I raised my hand he wouldn't notice and he'd continue with the lecture. The only things graded were a collection of hundreds of homework questions (at the end of the year), tests, and the final. There were no extra credit opportunities. It was a genuine struggle to keep up.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: The class is already hard within itself, but im not joking you have to teach yourself in his class. Good luck if this is ur last option. The tests are online with no camera, but they are extremely long.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Nazari doesn't so much as teach, as he just solves problems without explaining any sort of method or explanation. He goes really fast and it's difficult to keep up.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: This professor teaches like he is trying to speedrun class, and doesn't slow down when asked to. Drops the lowest test if you don't miss more than 2 classes and get a high homework grade unless he changes his mind an hour before the final (*cough*). Doesn't teach, but rather vaguely solves a problem while skipping steps and doesn't explain his work
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Very bluntly, those complaining aren't paying attention or asking questions. Nazari is an excellent teacher, incredibly thorough, and genuinely cares. But, he's INCREDIBLY fast. He asks for feedback/questions, and no one says they don't understand. It's not his fault. He is excellent. If you can't handle him, good luck in life after school...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Be ready to cry yourself to sleep at night. Honestly the worst way to teach calculus. If you miss one day of class you basically missed a whole unit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is perhaps the worst professor I have ever had, He is not only unforgiving but he is also not very understanding of student needs. Even though attending class is not Mandatory it might as well be as it is a requirement for him to drop the lowest test grade which is very helpful since his test question do not resemble any kind of work he shows :/
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took this class when covid was still very prevalent and he didn't care if you had to miss if you were sick. You miss more than 2 classes, won't drop your lowest test grade. He talks super fast&does not explain his work or problems clearly. All of his "lectures" consist of problems. His tests are online and are WAY harder than anything in lecture
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He doesnt really explain much in lectures. you have to learn yourself through ALEKS. Its a ton of assignment due on ALEKS at the end of the semester. He takes attendance . You get a test grade dropped if you attend all classes . He isn't very good at teaching but hes nice. I wouldn't take his class ever agin tho, ive never failed a class until him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very confusing lectures, he skips many steps when he is teaching us in class and very quiet and mumbles. He also makes every test online on Sundays between a certain time. Many students work on Sundays and can't take the tests. He also floods us with homework, like we don't have outside lives.
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: I want to start by saying I took calc in hs so this class was mostly a review for me. So I did not struggle, but my classmates did and I understand why. We only had half class time due to COVID, forcing him to speed through the material. He did explain much, just showed problems. However he was very nice, and I say you ask him questions after class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: His lectures were confusing. He did not really ever explain what we were doing or WHY we were doing it. I've had to learn everything on my own. I only go to class because he drops the lowest test grade if you miss 2 or less classes. I can tell he wants to help but he needs to adapt a new teaching style. I still dont know what a derivative is ):
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class for Calc 1. There's a ton of material to cover, and this professor covers all of it very thoroughly; be ready to pay a lot of attention. The material isn't necessarily difficult, and if you do find yourself stuck ask questions. He is very kind, and can provide you many examples until you understand. Sit close, his speech is soft.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a very smart professor, but makes lectures too difficult and takes harder ways to solve problems. The notes from class did not match the mathlab homework at all. Smart center taught me easier ways to do the units he taught the most complicated way. His students mostly fail the tests, so he is likely to curve grades.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: this class was hell for me, so if you're not really good at math i wouldn't recommend. he does have a pretty thick accent so i would sit close to the front. tests are online but in class, homework isn't due till the end of the semester but it is A LOT do don't wait till the last minute. he doesn't do a really good job at helping people understand.

Do not skip class if you can avoid it, he covers lots of material per class. And if you miss less than two classes and do 85% of the homework you get your lowest test grade dropped. He curves tests extremely well and gives decent examples in class. Make sure you understand the info before the next class. You should be able to pass if you study
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: C's get degrees. Math is my worst subject and I was happy just to not fail.. I didnt attend class much and did not do great on tests. Keep up with online homework and he is a very reasonable guy who wants you to do well! You are allowed a cheat sheet during all the tests.

If you are good at math, plan to attend EVERY class, and can learn without a professor teaching you... then i reccommend him. Professor Nazari has a very every accent and he just assumes everyone is as smart as he is. He goes through a lesson every day in class (very fast paced) and he just does every problem himself instead of helping.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a very respectful teacher. Though it's hard to teach concepts of math, he will start out with an example then explain. There are 4 tests, and one final. You can get a test grade dropped if you don't miss more than 2 classes and get a %85 on your homework. He curves tremendously. Pay attention, make a study group, and you will pass.
rating_tags: Respected--Lecture heavy

comment: Please, whatever you do, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. It felt like he was in his own world during class, doing math problems without explaining the concepts and going so fast my hand almost fell off trying to copy everything down. On top of this, he has an accent which made everything even more complicated. Even worse, he assigns so much HW.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Try to learn the material through Khan Academy before each class. Just ask questions in class, and do not assume that you will learn. He just does practice problems without really explaining the concept. Also, he takes attendance on a sheet of paper every single class. Attendance is a part of your grade. This is for MATH1190.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He has a super heavy accent and sometimes it is hard to understand him. Most of the time he was super boring and monotone and only did example problems as his way of teaching. There is a ton of online homework but the tests are multiple choice which is really cool. He takes attendance every class so you have to show up.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is somewhat quiet and has a decent accent, but sitting close makes this irrelevant. As with any math, practice will let you pass this class. Each section is fully covered and lots of examples are given, especially if he notices the class struggling. A few times, he asks the class how well they're following. ASK QUESTIONS, YOU'LL PASS
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Most of the class consists of lectures, in which the professor goes over every type of problem in every section. If anyone has a question, he will immediately attempt to explain by either breaking every step down to a super basic level, or by giving more examples. His light accent and soft speech are present, sit close and it's easy to hear him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mr. Nazari is a very caring and competent instructor. I have taken many math classes before, but he definitely knows his material and is really dedicated.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This was my first experience with a professor with a heavy accent. The accent plus his quiet tone and the fact that he goes over material quickly/briefly was not the best combination. If you take him just snag a seat up close, befriend khan academy videos, and practice his study guides. He knows his stuff and will help you if you have questions.
